Liturgical Music Sr Rose Clare Ehrlich CSA Administrative AssistantDRE Michelle Paxton BACK TO SCHOOL PRAYER Dear Lord Help them find where they need to go and go only where Your will leads To lead boldly even where few will follow and follow only the path You reveal Reveal kindness to those who yearn yearn for excellence in all they accomplish Accomplish in themselves the promise of all youve given Give them a desire for truth and passion for real learning Have them learn to give to love to forgive and encourage Stay by their sides and light up their souls Fill them guide them protect them and enliven them And by all this have them become the masterful creations You formed and longed for them to be even in their mothers womb For I know the plans I have for you declares the Lord plans to prosper you and not to harm you plans to give you hope and a future Jeremiah 2911 MASS INTENTIONS Saturday August 10 8:00am No Mass Intention 8:30am Rosary 4:00pm Confessions 4:35pm Rosary 5:00pm Mark Virgin Mary Vigil 1 Chr 1534151616121 Cor 1554b57 Lk 112728 Day Rv 1119a121 6a10ab 1 Cor 152027 Lk 13956 Fri Aug 16St Stephen of Hungary Jos 24113 Mt 19312 Sat Aug 17 Jos 241429 Mt 191315 Sun Aug 18 Twentieth Sunday in Ordinary Time Jer 3846810 Heb 1214 Lk 124953 NINETEENTH SUNDAY IN ORDINARY TIME August 11 2019 reminder that this Thursday August 15th is a Holy Day of Obligation as we celebrate the Solemnity of the Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary On this day the Church celebrates Mary the Mother of our Lord Jesus Christ being taken up body and soul into heaven This ancient teaching of Christs Church prefigured in both Enoch Gen 524 He brews 115 and Elijah 2 Kings 211 sees Gods work in Mary brought to completion here on earth as she is brought into eternity It is a day worth celebrating as it gives us joyful hope that we too may follow Marys path that points us always to her Son Jesus and to His Heav enly Kingdom Mass Times for the Holy Day Vigil Mass on Wednesday August 14th at 7:00PM Mass on Thursday August 15th at both 7 AM and 5:30PM As we approach a new academic year may we keep in our prayers our many students that are preparing to or have already re turned to school To our college students know of our prayers for you and that you always have a home here at St Josephs We look for ward to seeing you back home again during breaks and holidays To our high schoolers middle schoolers grade schoolers and all other students know of our prayers also May our good Lord keep and bless all of you as you begin a new year of studies If there is ever anything we can do to assist you in your studies know that the parish is here to support you This weekend we welcome Br Philip from the Congregation of the Holy Cross as our yearly mission speaker Br Philip is one of many brothers of the Holy Cross who strives to live an extraordinary life that brings hope to others Their ministry often finds them serving in the educational field as they seek to promote justice and peace throughout the whole world Br Philip will have a chance to speak with us in more detail at the end of each Mass this weekend regarding his and his con gregations missionary work Next weekend after having heard from Br Philip this weekend we will take up our monthly second collection normally in support of our St Vincent de Paul Fund to support the Congregations work to our brothers and sisters in need throughout the world Thank you now for your warm welcome to Br Philip and our parishs generosity to and support of this great missionary work Faithfully in Christ Fr David Note There will be no daily Mass on Monday August 12th as I will be away leading a retreat at Sacred Heart in Notre Dame IN and could not find a substitute My apologies for any inconvenience this may your gifts to St Josephs Sr Rose and the St Joseph Church Choir members are always searching for new voices They practice Wednesday evening following 700 Mass approximately 7:30pm and will begin again September 4th as we welcome Sr Rose back from her time off There is fun fellowship and an occasional trip for ice cream If you love to sing come and join them September 4th To sing is to pray twice St Augustine The St Joseph Womens Group will meet Tuesday September 10 at 7:00pm in the conference room We will be putting a calendar in place for our monthly meetings ie finishing our book discus sion
